abstract.text: A container for associating GameplayKit objects with a SpriteKit scene.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: When you create a scene in the Xcode SpriteKit scene editor, Xcode automatically creates a
object to manage any GameplayKit objects you add to the scene (entities, components, or pathfinding graphs) and archive them alongside the SpriteKit scene content.
To use a SpriteKit scene that contains GameplayKit objects, load the scene file with the
method. You can then use the
objects in the scene, and the
property to access the scene’s SpriteKit content.
Any SpriteKit node in the scene to which you’ve attached an entity or components automatically has a
object to manage the relationship between the node and the the
For more information on Entity-Component architecture and pathfinding graphs, see

abstract.text: Architect and organize your game logic. Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.
The abstract superclass for creating objects that add specific gameplay functionality to an entity.
An object relevant to gameplay, with functionality entirely provided by a collection of component objects.
A collection of nodes that describes the navigability of a game world and provides
methods to search for routes through that space.
A component that manages a SpriteKit node.
A container for associating GameplayKit objects with a SpriteKit scene.
Adds a GameplayKit entity to the list of entities managed by the scene.
The list of GameplayKit entities managed by the scene.
The list of pathfinding graph objects managed by the scene.
Loads the specified SpriteKit scene file, creating a
object containing the SpriteKit scene and associated GameplayKit objects.
Removes a GameplayKit entity from the list of entities managed by the scene.
Removes a pathfinding graph from the list of graphs managed by the scene.
The SpriteKit scene managed by this
object.
Identifies scene classes from other frameworks that support embedded GameplayKit information.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
